Service.name: Digit
Service.abstract_desc: Web-based graphics and information tool for Cassini geometry and trajectory visualization
Service.description: Digit for Cassini is a web tool whereby the user can see simulated views of what Cassini saw at any point during its flight, along with useful geometric and trajectory data. The user uses the tool via a common web browser, and is allowed to point in any direction in space and forward or rewind to any point in time. The tool is built in C++. Javascript event listeners on the web client pass information to the C++ tool on the server side, which is implemented as a set of CGI executables. The C++ / cgi tools are run anew on the server each time the user makes a new request, and pass back updated image or text information to the browser via javascript event listeners. Web hosting of digit requires compilation on the server platform with dependencies on the jpeg (public), cspice (JPL), and cgic (public) libraries, as well as the installation of .cgi, .js, .css, and .html files on the server. Permissions for proper execution of the tool often requires modifications to httpd.conf and other web server files.
